Text Formatting
These markup tags allow you to add formatting to the text of your comments and posts, similar to HTML.

SyntaxExample
[h1] Header text [/h1]
Header text
[b] Bold text [/b]Bold text
[u] Underlined text [/u]Underlined text
[i] Italic text [/i]Italic text
[strike] Strikethrough text [/strike]Strikethrough text
[spoiler] Spoiler text [/spoiler]
[noparse] Doesn't parse [b]tags[/b] [/noparse]Doesn't parse [b]tags[/b]
[hr][/hr]Render a horizontal rule

I used to love DbD but unfortunately the devs have taken almost all of the fun out of survivor's at this point. After nerfing borrowed time into the ground, they now nerfed DS into the ground. At this point there is almost nothing survivors can do against a camping killer besides rush gens, which is horrible for the person who doesn't get to play and horrible for the people who survive with no interaction. 

BHVR needs to return strong anti-camp mechanics into the game or it is going to lose its playerbase. It would be better to give killers back strong tools like previous undying if that's what's needed to balance anti-camp perks. I say all of this as someone who plays both roles equally and is rank 1 on both. I'm not a whiny survivor main, I just want the game to be good.

dont play this game. my hours in this game is due to pure addiction. you're going to get sucked in like you would with LoL, playing the game despite the toxicity, bugs, and overall boring/and or bad gameplay. the game is only exciting when a new killer or survivor is released, but after you learn the new mechanics and perks, it becomes the same again. save yourself the unhealthy relationship with this game please.

The game is truly one of a kind but marred by innumerable flaws both minor and major. The devs constantly try to sell Dead by Daylight as a meme party game but is constantly being balanced as if it were a competitive e-sport, this wouldn't be the worst thing in the world if the devs weren't so bad at it; having released a killer that is constantly slowed down in a meta where taking three seconds to reload your bottles as Clown or go fix a poorly placed trap as Trapper can cost you the game. It seems like the devs don't play their own game at a high level or just have nothing but contempt for the people who do. They constantly pump out microtransactions in the form of skins and battle passes like it were a free to play game even though it's a minimum $20 buy in if you can't wait for a sale. They knowingly release paid dlc that is either so broken it would embarrass an early access game or so underpowered as to make the best players sweat to keep up (Twins and Trickster respectively). In addition, because of the cash shop the extra skins that used to be freebies are now a ten dollar upcharge each. Furthermore, the devs tried to remove the ability to earn event skins for playing last Halloween, only relenting because the community kicked up an EA level PR nightmare. If you want to get into this game you have to accept that Behaviour has completely given up on pretending that they care about the quality of the game more than your wallet, and the worst part is they don't have to pretend because all of their competition on Steam has completely shot themselves in the foot to the point of complete irrelevancy, Behaviour has conquered the asynchronous multiplayer market with Dead by Daylight and they know it. 

If you can look past the awful monetization of the game you'll find that Dead By Daylight itself can be an extremely enjoyable game if you're willing to invest the time and funds into it. It's unfortunately one of those games that you don't understand until you've poured a couple hundred hours of your life into it. Unfortunately, the perk system suffers from extreme bloat, most of the perks, for survivor and killer, are worthless or situational at best. Especially as killer, not having the best perks will break you unless you have mastered the game, and on the killer side the best perks are spread around the roster so you'll have to cough up some dough or pray to your god of choice you get lucky on the shrine of secrets. Luckily, if you're only interested in survivor most of the best perks belong to the free survivors. 

Every update sadly breaks more than it fixes, as I mentioned before the Twins came out completely busted even though their problems were well documented in the PTB, and every time a new update comes out it breaks EAC forcing me to reinstall the entire game, extremely bad if you have a data cap. As the game stands, it can be extremely fun and there's nothing else like it. But Behaviour takes every chance they get to kneecap their game and shake down their playerbase for every nickel they've got. Couple that with how much you have to invest to really start playing I can't recommend it unless you're a masochist or a complete horror fiend like myself. Please do not buy this game if you're on the fence, make Behaviour do better.

Very good

Used to be ok, but all of the updates directly pander to killer(Buffs to starter killers, amazing perks that not only help you farm bloodpoints but find survivors,) while giving no support for survivors (audio desyncs, massive hitreg and hitbox issues, and nerfing perks that are directly used to counter playstyles/OP killer perks).

A game that is determined by perks you run will have a balance state that is directly affected by these said perks. There are plenty of perks, but many of them are useless or entirely overshadowed by better perks. 

A lot of these perks are situational and barely work how they should. Some are so broken and necessary that there is no reason not to run it. There are even perks that change the mindsets of how the survivors should play that match. You will never know that the killer is running them until it's too late however (looking at you, No ED).

You will find yourself having more fun if:

1. You don't care about the game balance and have plenty of friends to play with (Kill your friends will always be a good time).

2. You ONLY play killer.

3. You don't mind hackers.
ITS GARBAGE
